original: Bergdahl, Arvid Ferdinand, fil. lic., läroverksadjunkt, Karlskrona, f. 28/11/ 89 i Ö. Sönnarslöv, Krist. 1., av folksk:-lär. Nils B. o. Anna Svensso’n. G. 20 m. Elsie Lindblom. Barn : Marit f. 21, Gunnar 24. — Folksk :lär :ex. 10, stud: ex. i Lund 18, fil. kand. 23, fil. mag. 32, fil. lic. 47. Res. t. Danm. 13, Norge 19, Österr., Ital. o. Tyskl. 22, Tyskl. 23 (geogr.-biol. kurs i Halle a. S.), Barsebäckshamns zool. stat. 29. Folksk :-lär. i Ö. Hoby 10-11, i Kalmar 11-19, lär. v. Kalmar språk- o. hand:inst. 18-19, vik. lär. v. Lunds folksk :sem. 20, e. o. adj. i Hallsberg 20-22, ord. ämneslär. där 22, adj. 33, adj. i geogr. o. biol. m. hälsolära v. Karlskrona h. a. 1. sed. 37. Extrageolog v. Sv:es geoL und:sökn. 27-30, 32-35 o. 37-38. Skr.: Aspartiet v. Näset i Närke (25), Strövtåg kr. Hallsberg (33), En ås på Närkesslätten (36), Två blåtrylokaler i Närke (37), Diabasgångar o. gångdalar i trakten av Tisaren (43), Från naturlandskapet kring Tisaren (43), Två åsgropar. Studier i ett grustag (44), Glacialmorfoilog. stud. v. Kalmarsund (47).
translated: Bergdahl, Arvid Ferdinand, licentiate of philosophy, high school teacher, Karlskrona, born on November 28th, 1889 in Ö. Sönnarslöv, Kristianstad county, to primary school teacher Nils B. and Anna Svensson. Married to Elsie Lindblom in 1920 with two children: Marit born in 1921 and Gunnar born in 1924. Obtained a primary school teaching degree in 1910, studied in Lund in 1918, received a Bachelor of Philosophy degree in 1923, a Master of Philosophy degree in 1932, and a licentiate of philosophy degree in 1947. Traveled to Denmark in 1913, Norway in 1919, Austria, Italy and Germany in 1922, and Germany in 1923 for a geographical-biological course in Halle a. S. Also worked as a primary school teacher in Ö. Hoby from 1910 to 1911 and in Kalmar from 1911 to 1919. Worked as a teacher at the Kalmar language and trade institute from 1918 to 1919, as a substitute teacher at Lund primary school seminary in 1920, as a temporary assistant teacher in Hallsberg from 1920 to 1922, as a subject teacher there in 1922, as an adjunct professor in 1933 and as a geography and biology teacher with health science at Karlskrona higher vocational school since 1937. Was also an extra geologist in the Swedish Geological Survey from 1927 to 1930, from 1932 to 1935, and from 1937 to 1938. Published several articles and studies on various topics including Aspartiet v. Näset i Närke (1925), Strövtåg kr. Hallsberg (1933), En ås på Närkesslätten (1936), Två blåtrylokaler i Närke (1937), Diabasgångar o. gångdalar i trakten av Tisaren (1943), Från naturlandskapet kring Tisaren (1943), Två åsgropar. Studier i ett grustag (1944), and Glacialmorfoilog. stud v. Kalmarsund (1947).
